Description: Foot and lower body fragment of pottery Fikellura oinochoe; underside reserved; outside: beige slip with decoration in glaze fired orange-red; outside of foot glazed; above carination on lower body of vessel thin band, with alternating lotus flowers and buds above.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 146, no. Nau 113, pl. 25, fig. a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.051)
